1 — Count words

code
words
terms
count
Published

January 2, 2024

Modified

January 2, 2024

Load the data

library(tidyverse)

tv_ratings <- read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2021/2021-04-20/netflix_titles.csv')

Count totals of each type

library(tidyverse)
library(kableExtra)

type_count <- tv_ratings %>%
              count(type)

type_count
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  type        n
  <chr>   <int>
1 Movie    5377
2 TV Show  2410

Count totals of each type by release_year

year_type_count <- tv_ratings %>%
                      count(release_year, type)

year_type_count %>% head()
# A tibble: 6 × 3
  release_year type        n
         <dbl> <chr>   <int>
1         1925 TV Show     1
2         1942 Movie       2
3         1943 Movie       3
4         1944 Movie       3
5         1945 Movie       3
6         1946 Movie       1

Results in a wide table with totals

library(janitor)

tv_ratings %>%
  tabyl(release_year, type) %>%
  filter(release_year < 1960) %>%
  adorn_totals() %>%
  knitr::kable()
release_year Movie TV Show
1925 0 1
1942 2 0
1943 3 0
1944 3 0
1945 3 0
1946 1 1
1947 1 0
1954 2 0
1955 3 0
1956 2 0
1958 3 0
1959 1 0
Total 24 2

Rank occurence of words

tokens = words or phrases

Top 10 words in the show’s genre description.

library(tidytext)

word_count <- tv_ratings %>%
              unnest_tokens(word, listed_in) %>%
              count(word) %>%
              arrange(-n) %>%
              head(10)

word_count
# A tibble: 10 × 2
   word              n
   <chr>         <int>
 1 movies         4989
 2 tv             4972
 3 international  3636
 4 dramas         2810
 5 shows          2612
 6 comedies       1996
 7 action          871
 8 adventure       871
 9 romantic        864
10 documentaries   786

Exclude stop words / unwanted words

stop words = Common words or phrases that don’t provide value

word_count <- tv_ratings %>%
              unnest_tokens(word, listed_in) %>%
              count(word) %>%
              arrange(-n) %>%
              head(10)

word_count
# A tibble: 10 × 2
   word              n
   <chr>         <int>
 1 movies         4989
 2 tv             4972
 3 international  3636
 4 dramas         2810
 5 shows          2612
 6 comedies       1996
 7 action          871
 8 adventure       871
 9 romantic        864
10 documentaries   786
